5501.definition: [χείρων] irregular comparative of {{G2556}}; from an obsolete equivalent χέρης (of uncertain derivation); more evil or aggravated (physically, mentally or morally)

5502.definition: [χερουβίμ] plural of Hebrew origin ({{H3742}}); "cherubim" (i.e. cherubs or kerubim)

5503.definition: [χήρα] feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of {{G5490}} through the idea of deficiency; a widow (as lacking a husband), literally or figuratively

5504.definition: [χθές] of uncertain derivation; "yesterday"; by extension, in time past or hitherto

5506.definition: [χιλίαρχος] from {{G5507}} and {{G757}}; the commander of a thousand soldiers ("chiliarch"; i.e. colonel

5507.definition: [χίλιοι] plural of uncertain affinity; a thousand

5508.definition: [Χίος] of uncertain derivation; Chios, an island in the Mediterranean

5509.definition: [χιτών] of foreign origin ({{H3801}}); a tunic or shirt

5510.definition: [χιών] perhaps akin to the base of {{G5490}} ({{G5465}}) or {{G5494}} (as descending or empty); snow

5511.definition: [χλαμύς] of uncertain derivation; a military cloak

5512.definition: [χλευάζω] from a derivative probably of {{G5491}}; to throw out the lip, i.e. jeer at

5514.definition: [Χλόη] feminine of apparently a primary word; "green"; Chloë, a Christian female

5515.definition: [χλωρός] from the same as {{G5514}}; greenish, i.e. verdant, dun-colored

5516.definition: [χξϛ] the 22nd, 14th and an obsolete letter ({{G4742}} as a cross) of the Greek alphabet (intermediate between the 5th and 6th), used as numbers; denoting respectively 600, 60 and 6; 666 as a numeral

5517.definition: [χοϊκός] from {{G5522}}; dusty or dirty (soil-like), i.e. (by implication) terrene

5518.definition: [χοῖνιξ] of uncertain derivation; a chœnix or certain dry measure

5520.definition: [χολάω] from {{G5521}}; to be bilious, i.e. (by implication) irritable (enraged, "choleric")

5521.definition: [χολή] feminine of an equivalent perhaps akin to the same as 5514 (from the greenish hue); "gall" or bile, i.e. (by analogy) poison or an anodyne (wormwood, poppy, etc.)

5522.definition: [χόος] from the base of {{G5494}}; a heap (as poured out), i.e. rubbish; loose dirt

5523.definition: [Χοραζίν] of uncertain derivation; Chorazin, a place in Palestine

5524.definition: [χορηγέω] from a compound of {{G5525}} and {{G71}}; to be a dance-leader, i.e. (generally) to furnish

5525.definition: [χορός] of uncertain derivation; a ring, i.e. round dance ("choir"

5526.definition: [χορτάζω] from {{G5528}}; to fodder, i.e. (generally) to gorge (supply food in abundance)

5528.definition: [χόρτος] apparently a primary word; a "court" or "garden", i.e. (by implication, of pasture) herbage or vegetation

5529.definition: [Χουζᾶς] of uncertain origin; Chuzas, an officer of Herod

5530.definition: [χράομαι] middle voice of a primary verb (perhaps rather from {{G5495}}, to handle); to furnish what is needed; (give an oracle, "graze" (touch slightly), light upon, etc.), i.e. (by implication) to employ or (by extension) to act towards one in a given manner Compare {{G5531}}; {{G5534}}.

5531.definition: [χράω] probably the same as the base of {{G5530}}; to loan

5532.definition: [χρεία] from the base of {{G5530}} or {{G5534}}; employment, i.e. an affair; also (by implication) occasion, demand, requirement or destitution

5533.definition: [χρεωφειλέτης] from a derivative of {{G5531}} and {{G3781}}; a loan-ower, i.e. indebted person

5534.definition: [χρή] third person singular of the same as {{G5530}} or {{G5531}} used impersonally; it needs (must or should) be

5535.definition: [χρῄζω] from {{G5532}}; to make (i.e. have) necessity, i.e. be in want of

5536.definition: [χρῆμα] something useful or needed, i.e. wealth, price

5537.definition: [χρηματίζω] from {{G5536}}; to utter an oracle (compare the original sense of {{G5530}}), i.e. divinely intimate; by implication, (compare the secular sense of {{G5532}}) to constitute a firm for business, i.e. (generally) bear as a title

5538.definition: [χρηματισμός] from {{G5537}}; a divine response or revelation

5540.definition: [χρῆσις] from {{G5530}}; employment, i.e. (specially), sexual intercourse (as an occupation of the body)

5541.definition: [χρηστεύομαι] middle voice from {{G5543}}; to show oneself useful, i.e. act benevolently

5542.definition: [χρηστολογία] from a compound of {{G5543}} and {{G3004}}; fair speech, i.e. plausibility

5543.definition: [χρηστός] from {{G5530}}; employed, i.e. (by implication) useful (in manner or morals)

5544.definition: [χρηστότης] from {{G5543}}; usefulness, i.e. morally, excellence (in character or demeanor)

5545.definition: [χρῖσμα] from {{G5548}}; an unguent or smearing, i.e. (figuratively) the special endowment ("chrism") of the Holy Spirit

5546.definition: [Χριστιανός] from {{G5547}}; a Christian, i.e. follower of Christ

5547.definition: [Χριστός] from {{G5548}}; anointed, i.e. the Messiah, an epithet of Jesus

5548.definition: [χρίω] probably akin to {{G5530}} through the idea of contact; to smear or rub with oil, i.e. (by implication) to consecrate to an office or religious service

5549.definition: [χρονίζω] from {{G5550}}; to take time, i.e. linger

5550.definition: [χρόνος] of uncertain derivation; a space of time (in general, and thus properly distinguished from {{G2540}}, which designates a fixed or special occasion; and from {{G165}}, which denotes a particular period) or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay

5551.definition: [χρονοτριβέω] from a presumed compound of {{G5550}} and the base of {{G5147}}; to be a time-wearer, i.e. to procrastinate (linger)

5553.definition: [χρυσίον] diminutive of {{G5557}}; a golden article, i.e. gold plating, ornament, or coin

5554.definition: [χρυσοδακτύλιος] from {{G5557}} and {{G1146}}; gold-ringed, i.e. wearing a golden finger-ring or similar jewelry

5555.definition: [χρυσόλιθος] from {{G5557}} and {{G3037}}; gold-stone, i.e. a yellow gem ("chrysolite")

5556.definition: [χρυσόπρασος] from {{G5557}} and πράσον (a leek); a greenish-yellow gem ("chrysoprase")

5557.definition: [χρυσός] perhaps from the base of {{G5530}} (through the idea of the utility of the metal); gold; by extension, a golden article, as an ornament or coin

5558.definition: [χρυσόω] from {{G5557}}; to gild, i.e. bespangle with golden ornaments

5559.definition: [χρώς] probably akin to the base of {{G5530}} through the idea of handling; the body (properly, its surface or skin)

5560.definition: [χωλός] apparently a primary word; "halt", i.e. limping

5561.definition: [χώρα] feminine of a derivative of the base of {{G5490}} through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. a space of territory (more or less extensive; often including its inhabitants) Compare {{G5117}}.

5562.definition: [χωρέω] from {{G5561}}; to be in (give) space, i.e. (intransitively) to pass, enter, or (transitively) to hold, admit (literally or figuratively)

5563.definition: [χωρίζω] from {{G5561}}; to place room between, i.e. part; reflexively, to go away

5564.definition: [χωρίον] diminutive of {{G5561}}; a spot or plot of ground

5565.definition: [χωρίς] adverb from {{G5561}}; at a space, i.e. separately or apart from (often as preposition)

5566.definition: [χῶρος] of Latin origin; the north-west wind

5567.definition: [ψάλλω] probably strengthened from ψάω (to rub or touch the surface; compare {{G5597}}); to twitch or twang, i.e. to play on a stringed instrument (celebrate the divine worship with music and accompanying odes)

5568.definition: [ψαλμός] from {{G5567}}; a set piece of music, i.e. a sacred ode (accompanied with the voice, harp or other instrument; a "psalm"); collectively, the book of the Psalms Compare {{G5603}}.

5569.definition: [ψευδάδελφος] from {{G5571}} and {{G80}}; a spurious brother, i.e. pretended associate

5570.definition: [ψευδαπόστολος] from {{G5571}} and {{G652}}; a spurious apostle, i.e. pretended pracher

5571.definition: [ψευδής] from {{G5574}}; untrue, i.e. erroneous, deceitful, wicked

5572.definition: [ψευδοδιδάσκαλος] from {{G5571}} and {{G1320}}; a spurious teacher, i.e. propagator of erroneous Christian doctrine

5573.definition: [ψευδολόγος] from {{G5571}} and {{G3004}}; mendacious, i.e. promulgating erroneous Christian doctrine

5574.definition: [ψεύδομαι] middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to utter an untruth or attempt to deceive by falsehood

5575.definition: [ψευδομάρτυρ] from {{G5571}} and a kindred form of {{G3144}}; a spurious witness, i.e. bearer of untrue testimony

5576.definition: [ψευδομαρτυρέω] from {{G5575}}; to be an untrue testifier, i.e. offer falsehood in evidence

5578.definition: [ψευδοπροφήτης] from {{G5571}} and {{G4396}}; a spurious prophet, i.e. pretended foreteller or religious impostor

5584.definition: [ψηλαφάω] from the base of {{G5567}} (compare {{G5586}}); to manipulate, i.e. verify by contact; figuratively, to search for

5585.definition: [ψηφίζω] from {{G5586}}; to use pebbles in enumeration, i.e. (generally) to compute

5586.definition: [ψῆφος] from the same as {{G5584}}; a pebble (as worn smooth by handling), i.e. (by implication, of use as a counter or ballot) a verdict (of acquittal) or ticket (of admission); a vote

5587.definition: [ψιθυρισμός] from a derivative of ψίθος (a whisper; by implication, a slander; probably akin to {{G5574}}); whispering, i.e. secret detraction

5588.definition: [ψιθυριστής] from the same as {{G5587}}; a secret calumniator

5589.definition: [ψιχίον] diminutive from a derivative of the base of {{G5567}} (meaning a crumb); a little bit or morsel

5590.definition: [ψυχή] from {{G5594}}; breath, i.e. (by implication) spirit, abstractly or concretely (the animal sentient principle only; thus distinguished on the one hand from {{G4151}}, which is the rational and immortal soul; and on the other from {{G2222}}, which is mere vitality, even of plants: these terms thus exactly correspond respectively to the Hebrew {{H5315}}, {{H7307}} and {{H2416}})

5591.definition: [ψυχικός] from {{G5590}}; sensitive, i.e. animate (in distinction on the one hand from {{G4152}}, which is the higher or renovated nature; and on the other from {{G5446}}, which is the lower or bestial nature)

5594.definition: [ψύχω] a primary verb; to breathe (voluntarily but gently, thus differing on the one hand from {{G4154}}, which denotes properly a forcible respiration; and on the other from the base of {{G109}}, which refers properly to an inanimate breeze), i.e. (by implication, of reduction of temperature by  evaporation) to chill (figuratively)

5595.definition: [ψωμίζω] from the base of {{G5596}}; to supply with bits, i.e. (generally) to nourish

5596.definition: [ψωμίον] diminutive from a derivative of the base of {{G5597}}; a crumb or morsel (as if rubbed off), i.e. a mouthful

5597.definition: [ψώχω] prolongation from the same base as {{G5567}}; to triturate, i.e. (by analogy) to rub out (kernels from husks with the fingers or hand)

5598.definition: [Ω] the last letter of the Greek alphabet, i.e. (figuratively) the finality

5599.definition: [ὦ] a primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh

5600.definition: [ὦ] ,   including the oblique forms, as well as      ἦς;      ἦ;  etc. the subjunctive of {{G1510}}; (may, might, can, could, would, should, must, etc.; also with {{G1487}} and its comparative, as well as with other particles) be
